Lately, my friend was asking me how to set up python environment since he had tried many times on his windows based enviroment. I’m have few experience though and all of them is on Linux. All I can recall was about the embedded porting for SAMBA application in which some codes relates to python and some material for toolchain that is used scripts in python.

Here I note the steps for someone who needs as reference as well as for my friend.

– Install Anaconda Anaconda already is good start for rookie (like me) to prement of conflictions on package installation. We can find the latest one on https://www.anaconda.com/download/ and just clicking “next step” until installation sucessfully. After installation, we can open Anaconda Prompt with admin user. Check the conda version

Under Anaconda Prompt, create an enviornment which is based on python 3.5.2.

Check one of env you created, naming opencv_py352_demo

If you want to check all envs. and remove some of them, you can type:

Install opencv

– Spyder and SciPy Spyder editor is strong IDE tools, and likes MATLAB env and for mathematics, science, and engineering also I will include SciPy (pronounced “Sigh Pie”) lib, matplotlib to make them looks more like using under MATLAB which i familar with

open spyder IDE

Run an example on spyder
